topics.body:
You know getting philosophical here for a second, but I don't think I'm ever going to use the word "evil" again not cause I don't believe there is such a thing, but because it's overused.

The three ways people overuse the word "evil" summarized in a nutshell:
1)Used to morally whitewash everything as a means of negating any moral lesson one can take from a situation.
2)Used to oversimplify what lead to a situation.
3)Used as a means of whitewashing events to make it seem as though you could never go down the same road.


I'm going to totally godwin here, but what I mean by this is look at world war 2 history; very little is ever discussed about what events lead to the cause of world war 2.  The only thing you ever see anymore is about how the white horse of the allied forces road in saving the day, but no one ever talks about the economic and social reasons why hitler rose to power or how the economic conditions of post world war 1 created a volatile societal situation which caused dissatisfaction of those with monetary power, in that case the Jews and how extreme economic gaps can cause violence and extremism or how extremism obviously causes violence.

It seems as though 99% of the time the word is used it's used so that no one has to think and everything can automatically get swept away so everyone can go back to talking about <insert latest movie star getting caught by tabloids not wearing makeup>.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53abdde06368720b244b0400#post_53abdde06368720b244b0400
Yea. Sloppy language leads to sloppy thought.

Strangely enough, I have a break from my responsibilities and I realize I've been very sloppy in how I've comported myself.
Lazy and haphazard.
And the stress has made me short tempered and snappy.

So I've got to fix that.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53abdde06368720b244b0400#post_53abdde06368720b244b0400
I don't believe in good or evil, light or darkness, blessing or sin, etc.
I myself believe in right or wrong.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53abe02a6368720c28fe0400#post_53abe02a6368720c28fe0400
[bq="HJSDGCE"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53abdde06368720b244b0400#post_53abdde06368720b244b0400
I don't believe in good or evil, light or darkness, blessing or sin, etc.
I myself believe in right or wrong.[/bq]
I believe that everything is a cause and effect; not everything has a definitive cause nor does everything have a definitive effect nor must there be a cause nor must there be a effect and the and effect doesn't have to be equal.

To use a analogy if you roll a bowling ball down a steep road hill it could cause nothing or it could cause a twenty car pile up with dozens dead.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
